website_summaries.verdict: Classic simplicity meets fantastic coffee, thanks to this incredibly popular heat-resistant pour-over glass carafe that doubles as a storage receptacle.
pros: Glass does not absorb extraneous odors
Thick glass will last for years with careful use
Can purchase a cover and cool off in the refrigerator to make iced coffee
cons: Pour-over coffee can take longer than other methods of brewing
Should use only Chemex filters to get the best results

customer_reviews.title: Cheap glass not durable
customer_reviews.text: And another thing - it does not have 'feet' and the wooden collar does not fit - it is too big. POS I have been using Chemex for 20 years. Chemex makes the best coffee. This is my third beaker. But this glass beaker is about half the thickness of the original. For this price, I expect higher quality. Don't bother with Chemex - buy a less expensive competitor.
customer_reviews.author: eugene diou

customer_reviews.title: Not the same product as the original
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this new coffeemaker to replace one I have had over two years that broke. The new Chemex is very fragile in comparison to the older version. The glass is much thinner. I think that it would be very susceptible to chipping and cracking based on it's paper thinness alone. For nearly $50, I expect something that matches the original heftiness and durability similar to the one I originally purchased.
customer_reviews.author: StayInformed

customer_reviews.title: NOT ONE BLOODY FILTER FOR A FIFTY DOLLAR PURCHASE ?!
customer_reviews.text: NOT AN INTRODUCTORY FEW ?!?! FILTERS ?!?! and I know I was all TL;DR about the description, but i SRSLY thought there would be a WELCOME NEIGHBOR ! set of FILTERS. boo. VERY VERY boo. BTW, it's one of the most beautiful works of art I've ever seen. p.s., there is NO bottom to the top where the filter goes, this is not your grandma's Melita filter top.
customer_reviews.author: Country EpiscoPal in the Big City

customer_reviews.title: Please read
customer_reviews.text: It's a little big and beautifully designed ..... But it Doesn't keep the coffee warm very long. If you forget to take the lid off (sold separately:/) it will drop into your coffee cup and if you are in a hurry for a cup of coffee this is not for you .... BUT the coffee you make in this is delicious :) perfect for a great cup of coffee on the weekends :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes the best cup of coffee  without exception
customer_reviews.text: This has been my coffee maker of choice for decades now. Makes a clean, crystal clear cup of coffee. No residue in your cup as you get with a French press. Easy to clean-it's just one piece. And it is a beautiful, functional piece! Just read this: "The CHEMEX® can be found in museums throughout the world and is included in the permanent collection at the Brooklyn Museum, Corning Museum of Glass and MOMA, NY. The Museum of Modern Art displayed it as one of the best-designed products in 1943." (History-Chemex)
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Sara

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee ever, no plastic parts, classy
customer_reviews.text: Stopped brewing hot coffee in the coffee maker with plastic parts. Tried French press and the Chemex. The French press is great, but the coffee is more flavorful when made in the Chemex. It takes a bit longer, but is an easy process. Use good filters to remove bitterness and get a fine grind. A bit hard to clean. A couple of quick rinses are usually all you need, but if you are going to use soap inside, you'll want to get a bottle brush.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Good for larger needs
customer_reviews.text: Bought 10 cup chemex to replace hario V60 ceramic dropper after 3 years. I like that this has a bigger capacity. It is glass so it gets hot but the wood and leather wrap makes it easy to handle. The wood and leather wrap takes more time to put back after you take it off for cleaning. That’s my only complaint since the hario, you just throw away the filter and rinse easily. Coffee tastes good and not bitter. I recommend this if you typically make more than one serving of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: KAJ5129

customer_reviews.title: Classic series isn’t the same as original
customer_reviews.text: They changed the design. Thinner glass, deeper sprout groove, weird looking nipple halfway mark. Classic does not me original. We liked our old one better but this will suffice. The old one has the Chemex logo on the bottom, this new says Chemex when you look from the top. It reads Chewex when you look from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Rothman

customer_reviews.title: LOVE my Chemex!
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased my second Chemex (upgraded to the 10-cup after having been gifted a smaller one years ago). I long-ago ditched my other coffee makers for this. Surely it takes a little more proactive effort (grinding beans, boiling water, pouring the water over the beans), but it is so worth it for the rich flavor. If you've been on the fence, do yourself a favor and just buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Karoline

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. Great taste. Classy, sophisticated look. Great gift idea
customer_reviews.text: This product makes delicious coffee and consistently. I chose this coffee maker for health reasons. I love coffee and don’t like how most coffee pots run hot water through plastic to heat it, just doesn’t seem healthy for someone who drinks coffee everyday. I had also tried the steel coffee filters but after some time they acquire a metal taste which I don’t prefer. This glass coffee maker keeps coffee hot for a decent while and I really like the pouring spout. It just looks classy, even when pouring a cup for friends and family. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Karlskin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for all who love coffee!!
customer_reviews.text: I have several different types of coffee brewer's and this is MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE!! Coffee tastes clean & smooth (using only tap water) no matter if you like your coffee stronger or mild, there's absolutely no bitterness! The added convenience of keeping the coffee warm on the burner (lowest setting) is wonderful & it's tastes the same down to the last bit. Easy clean up too! I would also highly recommend purchasing the coffee filter's made specifically for it, they're all natural, no chemicals or bleaching. I'm definitely purchasing another for our oldest daughter who's getting married this fall!!
customer_reviews.author: Lt

customer_reviews.title: It works well and looks as hoped.
customer_reviews.text: This method of brewing is second only to the "American Press" coffee method. It has a tendency to lose heat quickly, so I would recommend moving the coffee to a good carafe. Cleaning is only a pain if it is left to sit and stain.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect coffee maker for camping or when there is no electric!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for camping when there is no electric! I used a reusable filter with this that I was a little hesitant to use but it ended up being perfect. The wooden piece with the leather tie is a little gimmicky but it serves it purpose. I actually replaced the leather tie with a piece of shock cord that keeps it tight. I'd buy this again (and if it ever breaks). I should have bought this years ago instead of using instant coffee on vacations.
customer_reviews.author: Michael MTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: The Best Way to Make Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Already owned this model myself for years and the coffee was so much better I stopped ever buying coffee from a shop and now much prefer to brew my own - I bought this one for my dad as a gift and he’s already so in love with how much better his coffee is he’s in the same boat! It will take a number of tried for you to get your process down perfect, but it’s super easy to use/clean and would recommend this brewing method to anyone who likes a really smooth and bright cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Rick F.

customer_reviews.title: Good Coffee
customer_reviews.text: The drip coffee technique was not cutting it. Every morning dreading the taste of the morning joe. Went with the French press for a while but found it a bit messy. Bought this with a metal basket and using the #4 filters from my drip days and was off to the races. Didn't have a slow pouring tea pot. Use a 40 fl oz thermos that allows a slow pour which is essential to wet the grind. Takes a while longer to pour but worth it. This is the way to go. Not looking back.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis R. Young

customer_reviews.title: Hard to pour with 1 hand
customer_reviews.text: The neck is so narrow, we have a hard time getting down into the bottom to clean and the glass is starting to stain. When I pour it, I'm a woman, my hands are small, so I have to use both hands to pour and if you don't pour slowly, too much coffee comes out at once and makes a mess on the counter. It's cool looking though. Unfortunately, we have gone back to our percolator for coffee. We bring it out when we have company just cuz it's cool looking. Then we transfer the made coffee to a carafe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware how you pour
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, but be careful. Mine broke in three months after normal use, I was pouring a cup of coffee and the wood pressed into the glass and it broke. I will order another but will change the way I hold it when I pour to prevent cracks and breaks. Don't just hold around the wooden collar to pour, maybe try supporting the bottom as you pour relieving the pressure of the wood against the glass.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Graham

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Simple and effective. I've tried a lot of specialty brewing equipment and after a lot of experimentation, the honest truth is that simpler is better. I use a Aeropress for personal use but becomes a pain when we have visitors. This can easily brew for a couple of people with a lot let less effort. Easy to use, easy to clean, no parts to break from use. It can be a little worrying to shatter, haven't tested that yet.
customer_reviews.author: Paul D.

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee ever
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who has been using a keurig for as long as I can remember. After he used the Chemex for a few days he said, "I don't even know what I was doing drinking that terrible Keurig coffee. This is the best cup of coffee i've ever had at home." Needless to say, he loves it. Takes a bit to figure out ratios but when you do, you will be set!
customer_reviews.author: ALYSSA THRIFT

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic coffee.  Not a fan of the wooden collar.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the 10-cup (50oz) coffee maker with the wooden collar. Yes it is beautiful and yes it makes fantastic coffee. The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that if I had it to do over I probably would have purchased the glass-handled model instead. When full pouring is awkward and requires both hands to keep it steady. My mother-in-law can't do it at all. Maybe a smaller 3 or 6-cup one is easier to pour from. As for cleaning the exterior so far I have been wiping it down with a warm damp cloth the best I can. I really don't want to untie the collar but suppose I must eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Jack D. Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee ever!
customer_reviews.text: The coffee from this coffee maker is the best ever. It just takes a little time to boil the water and let it drip through the filter. You will need to find-out where you can get your filters; the Chemex filters are not normally sold at markets/department stores but can easily be purchased on-line.
customer_reviews.author: cmr

customer_reviews.title: Immersive Experience
customer_reviews.text: The chemex is beautifully designed. It amplifies the experience of making and consuming coffee. I combine the chemex with a burr grinder and a kitchen scale. The pour-over coffee tastes great. I would recommend for anyone looking for an immersive coffee brewing experience.
customer_reviews.author: A. McQuoid

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice But...
customer_reviews.text: Nice design but so impractical. It doesn't hold heat at all. By the time I've put in all the water in the filter (have to wait for water to drip down), the coffee is lukewarm. The glass does get quite hot, so you have to use a potholder to handle it. Also, it is very difficult to clean, even with a bottle brush. I would not purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: The coffee tastes good!
customer_reviews.text: As a retired science teacher, I love the look of the brewer and the fact that it is all glass no plastic. The taste of the coffee is an improvement over our standard brewer. This brewer has opened a new learning adventure; water temp, coffee grounds to water ratios and how to execute an pour over. Interesting and fun not to mention tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Grosnick

customer_reviews.title: Randomly broke
customer_reviews.text: Ours just broke randomly and for no reason, we have had it about a month ;( so for the price this totally sucked. Not sure if it happened from heat or what?
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Larger size is versatile
customer_reviews.text: We love our new Chemex 10 cup coffee maker! For the two of us it is generous, so we need to adjust how much to make. The bigger size is great for serving guests too. The unbleached folder filters are amazing, giving the coffee a quality taste!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love to use it but has a few issues
customer_reviews.text: The spout always drips a few drips of coffee. The glass is not very strong so be careful. It makes about 4 cups of coffee. We love using it, just wish they didn't break so easy.
customer_reviews.author: bearded love

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was hoping for!
customer_reviews.text: Before buying the Chemex, I had been using a cheap two-cup French press and let me tell you my coffee now is worlds better! I used to get a residue of coffee grounds at the bottom of my glasses but since this item takes coffee filters it’s no longer an issue! The flavor is also much less dirty by comparison as the grounds aren’t pressed to the bottom steeping like tea. If you’re looking for a delicious cup of coffee with a bit of minimalism, this product is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Elegant Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Had this since November 2019 and I’m loving it. This is so easy to use for coffee! I love it! There is nothing negative to say about it. That’s a rarity these days.
customer_reviews.author: Dalya84

customer_reviews.title: Everything Chemex claims...it is.
customer_reviews.text: This was everything Chemex claims it is. I have numerous pour over makers but I need one larger decanter that could handle three coffee drinkers and this large Chemex worked. I’ve had it one month with daily use and love the clean cup of coffee. I also use a French press when I’m in the mood for a stronger less refine coffee. But my new “go to” is the Chemex
customer_reviews.author: Roadguyser

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my son for his Christmas present and he has been thrilled. It makes an exceptionally good cup of coffee! Seamless transaction. He is trying to figure out how to balance the coffee grinds to a smaller amount of coffee, but will figure it out. Excellent coffee maker
customer_reviews.author: Terri Locke

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a learning curve, but can brew excellent coffee
customer_reviews.text: A little bit of a learning curve to figure out how to use this, but after watching a few YouTube videos and practicing it a bit I think I'm starting to get the hang of it. I think the two most important factors apart from pour technique for a good brew are: pre-heating the glass with hot water so your brew holds its heat longer, and putting the thick side of the Chemex filter on the spout side of the funnel. With these things and some good coffee the Chemex can do magic
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice pour over coffee maker and it makes very good ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice pour over coffee maker and it makes very good coffee. Once you get a process down, it doesn't take any longer than any other coffee maker and I kind of like being actively involved in the coffee making process (my wife might disagree). One word of warning - even this relatively large 10 "cup" model is a fairly small volume - about four normal coffee mugs is the total capacity. So, if you are going to use it to replace a more conventional perk or drip coffee maker, you might want to go with a large model to have a comparable capacity.
customer_reviews.author: surffisher

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and simple in appearance and performance
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful carafe. I purchased a titanium gold pour over coffee filter as well and am very pleased with the results. The same coffee in the keurig produces a more bitter and coarse coffee experience. I am pleased tio say that I am happy with both the appearance and performance of this pour over coffee carafe.
customer_reviews.author: txex

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee, relaxing pace
customer_reviews.text: I had been making my coffee a Keurig for years using a My K-cup and just accepted the fines in the bottom of my mug. Finally, I decided to try filtering it and the coffee was so much better, duh. This sent me down the rabbit hole of trying to figure out how to make a better cup of coffee and enter the Chemex. My wife and I love this thing! It is not for those in a hurry. The extra time is worth the great cup of coffee. Beware, if you make a full "pot" of coffee it will cool quickly. So if you are against having to re-heat your coffee consider alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Durbin

customer_reviews.title: Our new daily drip....
customer_reviews.text: Once we understood the correct ratio of beans to water, this turned amazing! We use 55 grams of fresh ground beans to about 980 grams of water for two sixteen ounce coffees. It's a great balance of flavors! We also buy the brown chemex filters to accompany this. Would absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CE Chia

customer_reviews.title: Way better than keurig, still prefer my saeco for convenience
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my chemex, sure doesn't look big enough to hold 10 cups but I haven't actually measured yet, looks beautiful in my coffee bar though
customer_reviews.author: Zane Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: No plastic aftertaste!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s not your typical coffee maker, but it makes an amazing cup of coffee! Just be sure to use authentic Chemex coffee filters. I boil the water in my ceramic teapot and it goes through coffee and filter into this glass Chemex, no plastic parts involved like a typical coffee maker and you can really taste the difference!
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Smooth & top notch taste!
customer_reviews.text: Love Chemex coffee, the copper filter & pour over lid! A great addition to my kitchen tools...only the best!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Himes

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Man we really debated making this switch but it is absolutely worth it! It takes me about 15 minutes to make a full pot of coffee but it’s SO tasty! I am no longer tempted to run out for coffee shop coffee. This is how coffee should taste!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Favorite
customer_reviews.text: Stopped using “press & brew” maker years ago. Used to having 40oz/8cup, but had a crack so upgraded to this. So great. Best cup of coffee imo. Guests always agree
customer_reviews.author: C R

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement gift for my son. He had a 6 cup one that he absolutely loved until he knocked it over and broke it. I replaced it for him because he loves making coffee in this pot! He uses it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Gets extremely heavy when even 1/2 full
customer_reviews.text: Loved this at 1st. It is the large size that I needed and still is, as I will reorder it. But....... It is heavy when even 1/2 full and it just broke on me when slightly bumped in taking it out of the dishwasher. Shattered in many pieces and not a few as would be the case if it were tempered to not shatter. I thought this was tempered glass.
customer_reviews.author: CHBeule

customer_reviews.title: Glad I jumped on the bandwagon
customer_reviews.text: Great aroma. Wish the filters weren’t so expensive. Love being able to keep the Chemex on a warm stove top
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: these coffee makers are the best, make great coffee but they are very fragile
customer_reviews.text: these coffee makers are the best, make great coffee but they are very fragile. One bump and they shatter all over the place, still have a piece of one of them in my foot
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M Lands

customer_reviews.title: Makes the Best Coffee
customer_reviews.text: Have a had a Chemex for 40 years and still makes the best coffee. My last one broke and Received new one timely.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W. Squires, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: If you love pour over flavor this is a MUST!
customer_reviews.text: Incredible flavor when you you use the right ratio of grounds to water. Beautiful display piece too. I love the clean lines and simple perfection of this vessel. Use this method when you are making several cups to be served at the same time. Otherwise, the coffee will cool fairly quickly.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Simple and great
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity of the pour over coffee Chemex. There is absolutely no way your coffee can't taste great. In the regular coffee pots a lot of time the coffee tastes bad due to the machine needing to be cleaned and even after cleaning the coffee still has a bad taste. The Chemex is so easy and there is nothing in the way of your coffee tasting great.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Vallerga

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable Difference
customer_reviews.text: It is unbelievable how much better a pour over cup of coffee is compared to the standard cup of drip coffee. The Chemex glass coffee maker is high quality as you can tell by the density of the glass, and it feels sturdy. No feeling like you might break it at any time. Has changed my mornings as my coffee's quality is out of this world. Thank you Chemex! A++ product
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Graves

customer_reviews.title: An excellent, reliable product.
customer_reviews.text: After some 50 years of use, my first Chemex did not survive packing and unpacking during our remodeling. Needless to say, I had to replace it immediately. It is one of several different types of coffee makers I use. It makes consistently good coffee and has a beautiful presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee with a little patience
customer_reviews.text: An older method of making coffee, but still a good one. Chemex, or pour over, makes a smooth and clean cup. If you follow the instructions, you will end up with a crisp cup of coffee. The pot feels thin, and fragile, but I've bumped a number of times without anything more than a glassy ringing. The wood and leather holder work well, look pleasant, and are well sealed. The pot pours smoothly, with the spout shaping a nice stream that does not splatter. Something that always annoyed me when using the Bodum version of the same pot.
customer_reviews.author: Irrevocable Trust

customer_reviews.title: Not as I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: Will be returning. Did not like coffee flavor or the fact container is too hot to pour first cup.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schnell

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Nice, easy way to make a really good pot of coffee. I order a gold coated titanium cone to use instead of the paper filters (that notoriously break on me when I remove from the pot) and a little glass lid to keep the heat in. Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: ABS

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product use it every morning. Even my husband can make coffee now as long as I get everything ready.
customer_reviews.author: ina320

customer_reviews.title: A must have for coffee and design lovers alike
customer_reviews.text: As a coffee drinker throughout the day, I have found this to provide a good amount of coffee for two people. The filters are specifically made to filter out the bitterness out of the grounds which makes very good coffee. Not being a black coffee drinker, in a pinch, I have found this coffee to be good without any milk or creamer. It is that good. The design is amazingly perfectly created as the coffee streams straight down the stream like cutout on the carafe, pouring directly down without spilling over the sides. Very pleased with this product. Well done, Chemex!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny N

customer_reviews.title: Good coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Love the coffee -- it's probably their filters that make the difference, though. Would give 5 stars, but the thing is so thin I'm afraid I'll break it when I wash it. And the wooden handle, while kinda cool and retro, is a pain to get on and off.
customer_reviews.author: DiscerningCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Filters???
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how good the coffee is...Yet! Could very well be 5-star. However, I’m unable to use it until my filters (delivered separately) are delivered in 5 days. Would it kill Chemex to include a few sample filters with the brewer??? Would go a long way to increasing customer satisfaction. Cheap move if I’ve ever seen one!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Pennino

customer_reviews.title: Not the same...
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a chemex for 5+ years and mine broke recently (my fault) so I replaced it. The glass is definitely noticeably thinner and the wooden collar is coming apart, right out of the box. I do really love chemex coffee, so I am going to continue to use it, but I’m wondering now how long it’s going to last.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Still learning how to use this, but for the most part I like it. I bought the coffeesock to go with it, I feel like it takes away from the flavor and the oils. I do normally use a French Press, so the full body and flavor is there. Overall I like the product and definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Meagen Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it’s chemex. It’s great I recommend getting a reusable metal filter.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Best cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Just remember to pour the a little water, slowly, and let the beans bloom before adding the rest. It's like decanting but for coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Chicken Sammich

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Will order again as gift
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Brand new. Perfect. I will be buying it again for gifts. I just love it
customer_reviews.author: Maria Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Better (much) than French Press!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing makes the best coffee! I use it religiously on the weekend with fresh ground beans makes 10 5oz cups with 50oz of 200 degree water. Takes a little while but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bellouny

customer_reviews.title: Back for more...
customer_reviews.text: This is actually our second Chemex pour-over purchase, as our first one lost a fight with the countertop. *tears* We had the first one for years and, although it is not our main coffee maker, we loved using it. We will just be a bit more careful with this one!
customer_reviews.author: 950sew

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works super well. Able to make multiple cups or just one. Easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Kera

customer_reviews.title: Cynical at first
customer_reviews.text: Bought this coffee maker with a closed mind, but decided to give it a try after reading the thousands of glowing reviews I read on-line, plus the price wasn't too high if I ended up hating it. Well, after giving it a try- I love it and can totally tell the difference in taste. Like everyone else said- the magic is in the coffee filters and there is no more bitterness to your coffee! The only drawback is the time it takes to make, but if you have the time it's totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Maddely

customer_reviews.title: Love Chemex Coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the one we broke. Chemex coffee is great and have never gone back to drip, the flavor is so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Coffee at its best!
customer_reviews.text: Have used a chemex for many years with great satisfaction. I've tried other coffee makers but not one compared to the flavor received using a chemex.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Blaney

customer_reviews.title: excellent way to brew coffee
customer_reviews.text: It brews an excellent 10 cups of coffee. This is well made and durable. I have no complaints and use it every morning.
customer_reviews.author: M. Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Love love love the Chemex my 8 cup broke (our ...
customer_reviews.text: Love love love the Chemex my 8 cup broke (our fault) and needed one right away and to find a 10 cup made my Hubby and I even happier!! Would have taken days to order through other stores lucky and so happy Amazon had it on prime 😃Esp the 10 cup!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Clean Brew
customer_reviews.text: Everything we'd hoped for, although it would be nice to find a warmer tray that fits. Glad we purchased this unit, and would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: cappy102

customer_reviews.title: Delicious coffee every time!
customer_reviews.text: This carafe has been a staple in my kitchen for decades. Its easy drip system delivers full-bodied, delicious coffee every time.
customer_reviews.author: trees

customer_reviews.title: Best coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Excellent buy. I definitely prefer pour over to the other brew methods I've used. This Chemex is large enough to fill my coffee mug and have plenty for my wife's morning coffee as well. I would probably buy the glass top for this if you plan to have multiple cups without transferring to a travel mug.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: My favorite way to brew coffee! (and I work in the specialty coffee industry)
customer_reviews.text: The Chemex is hands down my favorite way of brewing coffee. I own a vac pot, aeropress, espresso machine, French press, and an ice brewer - the Chemex shines above them all. I love how clean yet loud the coffee flavor is. I also like how the Chemex acts like a decanter and cools the coffee just slightly so it is right in it's peak flavor zone with the first sip. A must buy! Be sure to avoid the natural filters, they leave terrible notes of cardboard (even after a good rinse).

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both love the Chemex Coffee Maker. We were tired of drinking coffee that was brewed in plastic, and that was often too bitter or acidic. Chemex takes care of both concerns. The coffee is smooth and delicious, so it is worth the slightly longer time it takes to make. The beautiful glass design also looks far more attractive and takes up less space on our kitchen counter than our old ugly plastic auto drip maker did. The unbleached square filters are an absolute must for perfect coffee and easy cleanup.

product_meta.title: CHEMEX Classic Series, Pour-Over Glass Coffeemaker, 10 Cup - Exclusive Packaging
product_meta.description:
Color:Clear

Invented in 1941, CHEMEX has been brewing perfect filtered coffee for generations. Its iconic hour glass shape is so beautiful, it can be found in some of the most prestigious museums worldwide. Its design, timeless and functional, has never been altered. The perfect blend of art and science, simple to use and extraordinary results. Accept no imitations.
The CHEMEX carafe is made from non-porous, tempered borosilicate glass - like that used for labware. Therefore it is totally pure, imparting no flavors of its own and is also resistant to thermal shock. The Chemex can be used for brewing both hot and iced beverages, including coffee and tea.


The Ten Cup Classic Series used together with the scientifically designed, patented CHEMEX® Bonded Filters, will guarantee that our pour over brewing process will deliver the perfect cup of coffee, without any sediments or bitter elements.

Includes a polished wood collar with leather tie.

Capacity: 50 Ounce
Height: 9 1/4"
Diameter: 5 1/8"
Item: CM-10A

All CHEMEX Coffeemakers are made of the highest quality, non-porous Borosilicate glass which will not absorb odors or chemical residues
The patented CHEMEX pour-over design allows coffee to be covered and refrigerated for reheating without losing flavor
All CHEMEX Coffeemakers are measured using 5 oz. as 1 cup
